bug.short_desc: enabling/disabling javascript via Tools|Options|Content|Enable Javascript requires a restart.

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.16) Gecko/20110319 Firefox/3.6.16
As it says. It is not made clear that a restart is necessary.
Reproducible: Always
Steps to Reproduce: 1. Create a new profile & start it 2. You are taken to the 'firstrun' page which has some panels of colourful themes 3. run the mouse over them; the themes are applied into the widget areas of FX (toolbar, bookmars bar etc.) 4. go to Tools|Options|Content and untick Enable Javascript option. 5. wave mouse around, themes are still copied to panel. 6. restart fx, wave mouse over them theme panels and they're not applied. ... Re-enabling likewise requires a restart also. Actual Results: ...
Expected Results: Javascript should either be disabled immediately or the Enable Javascript option should have a "... (requires restart)" rider.
Searched for similar bug filing, could not find one. Also and unrelated, bugzilla does not allow you to enter windows 2003/2008 as OSs on this page <https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/enter_bug.cgi?product=Firefox>
Modified platform to windows 2008; could not specify this initially.
